translation1: "Since its introduction in 2001, the Valvetronix series from VOX has constantly evolved, which among other things led to the combination of advanced modeling technology with the \"Valve Reactor\" circuit, which perfectly imitates the behavior of a tube amplifier. With the VT20X/VT40X/VT100X Amps, we are presenting a completely new modeling engine that is absolutely state-of-the-art in terms of sound. Thanks to the VET technology (Virtual Element Technology), which is based on the analysis of components and amp circuits, the VTX amplifiers wait with an authenticity that is absolutely impressive.Also do auch diese Amps den mehrstufigen Valvetronix-Röhrenvorverstärker enthalten. Dieser beruht teilweise auf echten analogen Schaltungen, weil diese die Klangvariationen und Nuancen eines Röhrenverstärkers einfach besser hinbekommen als jede Simulation. Zusätzlich zu dieser ausgeklügelten Schaltung bieten die VTX-Verstärker ein geschlossenes Gehäuse und ein Bassreflexsystem, aus dem die natürlichen Resonanzen nur so sprudeln.With the \"Tone Room\" software from VOX, you can even correct and bend historical facts on the virtual level, so that the amp and effects sound exactly as you have always imagined it. The perfect combination of tube sound with modeling technology is mainly due to the 2001 introduced VOX Valve Reactor technology. Of course, it has been refined several times since then to meet new sound requirements, which led to another performance boost of the VOX Valvetronix series in 2010 - with more dynamics as well as numerous and significantly improved amplifier models.From the handy VT20+ to the VT120+ with two speakers, the new VT+ Valvetronix series has been designed in such a way that all guitarists looking for maximum sound diversity will find what they're looking for. All guitarists dream of the compression and dynamics of a tube amplifier: they expect a fat sound, nuanced reproduction of playing dynamics and string attack, as well as prompt response. During a detailed analysis, VOX engineers discovered that the final stage determines the tube character of an amplifier and developed the VOX Valve Reactor technology based on this finding.The valve reactor circuit of each VT+ amplifier perfectly reproduces the behavior, subtle nuances, and sound character of a tube amplifier."

translation1: "Basketball Bundesliga: Debacle of MHP Riesen Ludwigsburg against Merlins Crailsheim At least Johannes Patrick was left. Again nothing: For the second time within less than three months, the Riesen lost in Crailsheim - and how!Before the game, Ludwigsburg's coach John Patrick looked back on the cup defeat in October at the Hakro Merlins Crailsheim and said: \"We still have some anger in our stomach.\" But this anger did not subside after the game - on the contrary, it was further fueled by the 61:72 (28:38) defeat in the Basketball Bundesliga. What was more disappointing than the bare result was the way the team performed.A substitute statistic is named, which expresses the entire dilemma: The triple quote amounted to just 13 percent, 4 goals (all scored by young Johannes Patrick) in 31 attempts - more questions? The answer was provided by John Patrick: \"We were not concentrated enough after our victory in Tenerife and did not implement what we had trained for, namely moving the ball.\"The reaction of his counterpart Sebastian Gleim was completely different: \"It was a great game to win for the second time against Ludwigsburg,\" said the happy coach. \"It felt like playing in front of 10,000 people.\" There were only 750 spectators in the Hohenlohe Arena on Saturday, but they made the most of it.Not least because of BBL top scorer T.J. Shorts, who marked 22 points and led his team's play. \"The best playmaker I have ever trained,\" praised Gleim. While Patrick's team's key performers, such as Jordan Hulls (0 points) and Jonah Radebaugh (7), failed throughout the line.Only in the last quarter (22:15) did the giants prevent a total disaster and came within eight points, after they had already trailed by 39:59. Besides Johannes Patrick, Justin Simon also scored 12 points. Fortunately, there was plenty of time left for discussion.Already on Wednesday (7:00 PM), the giants receive the Skyliners Frankfurt, with a maximum of 750 spectators in Ludwigsburg before then."

translation1: "In the name of the people: Laypeople sit in everyday clothes on the judge's bench in the courtroom. But a lot depends on their judgment, even if they don't wear a robe: Jurors decide with professional judges whether and for how long someone will go behind bars.Two of them report in a conversation with the \"Public\" about their time at the Bad Kreuznacher Landgericht: Sascha Wickert from Boos and Ruth Ertz from Bad Kreuznach are two of a total of 125 lay judges at the Landgericht at John-F.-Kennedy-Straße."

"I am frustrated with Sky Sport F1 Hello dear F1 fans, the quality on the German Sky has decreased significantly throughout the season, so I want to vent a bit with this post. Firstly, the transmission was interrupted during the F2 race to ensure punctual F1 coverage.Although the schedule was significantly behind due to the delayed start and the crash at the beginning, it would still have been possible to show the last (planned) ten minutes as well as the championship decision. However, it seems that for legal reasons, F1 has priority and everything else has to be restricted, so Sky DE probably had no choice. Sky UK, on the other hand, broadcast the race until the end.Despite a small compliment: the commentator Olivier Zwartjes has accompanied the difficult situation around the heavy accident well. Then there was again a rule incompetence among the commentators Sascha Roos and Ralf Schumacher, so both did not know that you can change tires under a red flag. Although this situation occurred in Imola, Baku and Silverstone this year, both only came to the decision that Verstappen can change tires when there were corresponding radio messages to this topic to Hamilton.At Sky UK and RTL, both commentators immediately knew that there is a possibility for Verstappen. I believe that one should simply know such elementary rules when commenting on Formula 1 for a pay-TV broadcaster. It is also not the first riddle regarding what is now allowed or prescribed by the rules, both have simply had constant uncertainties in the topic of rules.Generally, I don't like the artificial commentary style of Roos, but I have to admit that it is a matter of taste. However, I find Heiko Wasser from RTL much better, even though I don't like his constant jokes, which make both of them appear unprofessional, such as ordering coffee at (equally clueless) reporter Peter Hardenacke or \"UuuuuHD\" from Ralf Schumacher.The last one brings total chaos in the commentary, which he apparently does not take seriously. Not least, advertising simply takes over at Sky, and in the final stretch, Sky is the only channel that goes into advertising, as one can hear from F1TV after the race, where only the German soundtrack without commentary is available directly after the race. Neither ServusTV nor ORF do this.Both of these channels make less advertising during their training than Sky, and that as a free TV channel. Although I must praise Glock and Baumgartner for their work, this alone does not allow me to overlook the disadvantages. The rest of the Sky Sport F1 program is also very scarce and full of repeats.Overall, Sky is truly the worst German-speaking broadcaster for Formula 1. Ironically, RTL does a better job with the four races they are still allowed to transmit, except for the advertising. So, at least, the grandiose F1 season makes significantly less fun than it would be with a reasonable broadcaster.I would be interested in your opinion."
